articles.title: About this site
articles.description: Some additional details about the website
articles.contents: This site is my online repository of my thesis to be.

articles.title: Identifying subspace using Hierarchical Bayesian Modeling
articles.contents:
There are two main focuses of this chapter:
Ways of identifying the subspace to construct the hierarchy.
Which feature or subspace should be at which level.

articles.title: Baseline Comparison
articles.contents:
The purpose of this chapter is to justify why the hierarchical model works better or why it is important to work on hierarchical modeling.
Thus it has to be compared to some baseline methods.
I will have to conclude what baseline method/s I want to compare with after I have done my literature review.

articles.title: Pathway construction
articles.contents:
The purpose of this chapter is to build a sub-model using selected metabolites and use this sub-model to build a bigger model that will incorporate metabolic pathway.
Therefore this chapter has been organised into two parts:
Building a sub-model using selected metabolites
This is basically applying the variable selection method I identified in my literature review.
Using the sub-model to build a bigger model by applying the hierarchical model I created in Chapter 1 and 2 and extend it to accomodate pathway construction.

articles.title: Welcome to my corner
articles.contents:
This is my first ever website that I created using Rmarkdown. I am hoping to use this website to host my PhD thesis later on.
Watch this space for updates.

articles.title: About me
articles.contents: I am a PhD student with the Australian National Phenome Centre at Perth, Western Australia. I am currently investigating if Bayesian statistics can be used to construct a metabolic pathway and if treating this pathway as a hierarchical space will improve phenotype prediction.

articles.contents:
History of Bayesian Statistics in general and its application to different fields from 1995 - 2020.
what has changed?
is there any more problems to be solved?

articles.title: Variable selection in Metabolomic
articles.contents:
Variable selection method commonly used in metabolomics
What are the available methods out there?
Bayesian vs.Â Frequentist selection method
pros and cons of each
any gap to fill?
what is the most approproate one for metabolites selection?
NOTE: our metabolites are highly correlated with one another, so whichever method I end up selecting must be able to handle multi-collinearity well and able to impose sparsity to reduce the high-dimensionality.
